result.execSummary:
The defendant Kurt J Nejedlo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid at rate of $25.00 per month commencing November 1, 2015 or penalty of 6 days Huber for non-payment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kurt J Nejedlo

defendant.name: Nejedlo, Kurt J

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kurt J Nejedlo in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions the defendant why he was late.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #3.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #3.  Count #4 is dismissed and read in.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Perkins makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following to count #3:
FINE: $694.00
Total amount due to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 11/1/2015 .  Failure to pay; the Court orders alternate sentence of 6 days Huber

Defendant Kurt J Nejedlo in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Perkins moves for a plea hearing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kurt J Nejedlo in court.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant to go directly to the public defenders office, to return to court at 10:30 am.  Case recalled at 10:34 am.  Public defendants office will represent the defendant.  Hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant to have no contact with the co-actor.

Defendant Kurt J Nejedlo in court.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.
